item.title: South of Midnight from Compulsion Games Is Out April 8
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/south-of-midnight-is-out-on-april-8/

During the Xbox Developer Direct 2025, Compulsion Games (Contrast, We Happy Few) revealed the release date for South of Midnight, their first game since being acquired by Microsoft in 2018. South of Midnight will be available through PC or Xbox Series S|X on April 8 (a month later than the previously rumored date), which is also when Game Pass subscribers will find it in their libraries.

Pre-orders are now open, too. The Premium Edition includes up to five days of early access and digital access (in English) to:
• South of Midnight Artbook
• Original Soundtrack composed by Olivier Deriviere
• The Boo-Hag Comic book by Rob Guillory
• Music Video: Songs & Tales of South of Midnight
• Documentary: Weaving Hazel’s Journey, Director’s Cut

The Steam page also now features the official PC system requirements for South of Midnight.

Minimum:

    • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
    • OS: Windows 10/11
    • Processor: AMD Ryzen 3 1300X / Intel i3-8100
    • Memory: 12 MB RAM
    • Graphics: AMD RX 580 / Nvidia GTX 1060
    • DirectX: Version 12
    • Storage: 55 GB available space
    • Additional Notes: Performance scales with higher-end systems

Recommended:

    • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
    • OS: Windows 10/11
    • Processor: AMD 1600X / Intel i5-7600K
    • Memory: 16 MB RAM
    • Graphics: AMD RX 6600 / Nvidia RTX 2060 / Intel Arc A580
    • DirectX: Version 12
    • Storage: 55 GB available space
    • Additional Notes: Performance scales with higher-end systems

During the showcase, Game Director Jasmin Roy discussed some of South of Midnight's key spells:

Push, Pull, and Weave are some of the spells at your disposal that give you a tactical advantage during a fight. Timing is everything. Pull distant enemies close to start melee combos, push them back to interrupt and stun their attack, then press the advantage with follow-up strikes.

The game is expected to take between ten to twelve hours to complete.

item.title: Ninja Gaiden 4 Announced for PC and Consoles With a Fall 2025 Release Window; Ninja Gaiden 2 Black Now Available
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/ninja-gaiden-4-announced-for-pc-and-consoles-with-a-fall-2025-release-window-ninja-gaiden-2-black-now-available/

Ninja Gaiden 4, the first new main entry in the series developed by Team NINJA in years, has been announced today for PC and consoles.

The fourth main entry in the series, which is being developed in collaboration with PlatinumGames, was revealed during today's Xbox Developer Direct with an action-packed trailer that highlighted how the new game will masterfully combine the challenging gameplay the series is known for with PlatinumGames fast-paced gameplay. Playable characters Yakumo and series' protagonist Ryu Hayabusa will be able to take on a variety of powerful enemies using different fighting styles as well as some of the series' iconic special techniques, such as the Izuna Drop. With a level design featuring enhanced verticality and dynamism and a lot of challenges and secrets hidden inside this chaotic and dark recreation of Tokyo, Ninja Gaiden 4 is looking to be a more than worthy new entry in the series.

Besides announcing Ninja Gaiden 4, which will release this Fall on PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X and Xbox Series S, Team NINJA revealed Ninja Gaiden 2 Black, the definitive edition of the second entry in the series. Available starting today on PC, PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S, this new version of the game features enhanced visuals powered by Unreal Engine 5 and additional content not found in the original, such as multiple playable characters.

Ninja Gaiden 4 launches on PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, and Xbox Series S during Fall 2025.

We already knew the game would be rather heavy, which the specs below have certainly confirmed. All of them require 16GB RAM, Windows 10/11 with DirectX 12, and an SSD.

Assassin's Creed Shadows will support the following features on PC:

  • Raytraced Global Illumination and Reflections
  • In-Game Benchmark Tool for Performance Analysis
  • Ultra-Wide Resolution Support
  • Upscaler and Frame Generation: Intel XeSS 2, NVIDIA DLSS 3.7, AMD FSR 3.1
  • Uncapped Framerate
  • In-Depth Customization Options
  • Dynamic Resolution Support
  • HDR Support
  • AMD Eyefinity and NVIDIA Surround Compatible

Going back to the pre-orders, customers can choose from the Standard Edition (available for $69.99 on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC), the Digital Deluxe Edition (priced at $89.99), and the Collector's Edition (which costs $229.99).

The Digital Deluxe Edition will include the base game, the “Sekiryu Dual Pack” with gear and weapons for both Naoe and Yasuke, the “Sekiryu Hideout Pack” (hideout cosmetics), and “Mastery Points”. The Collector's Edition will include the base game, the “Sekiryu Dual Pack”, the “Sekiryu Hideout Pack”, “Mastery Points”, and physical content. The physical content will be a Steelbook, the World map, Naoe & Yasuke figurine, Naoe's life-sized Katana Tsuba, a Wall Creed Scroll, a 76-paged collector's artbook, and 2 sumi-e lithographs.

All pre-orders for Assassin's Creed Shadows will include the previously leaked Claws of Awaji expansion, which will launch this year. Claws of Awaji will add a new open world region with more than 10 hours of additional content, as well as new skills, equipment, abilities and a new weapon for Naoe, the Bō. In this new adventure, the main characters will travel to the mysterious island of Awaji where they will be relentlessly pursued by the Sanzoku Ippa, a dangerous new faction threatening the region.
